title: SHM - pendulum on Earth and Moon

content.question: A simple pendulum near the surface of Earth has a period <math alttext="T sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>E</mi></msub></math>. The same pendulum is transported to the surface of the Moon, where the acceleration due to gravity is approximately <math alttext="the fraction g over 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math>, and the pendulum has a period <math alttext="T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>M</mi></msub></math>. The ratio of <math alttext="T sub M to T sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>M</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>E</mi></msub></math> is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="1 to the square root of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>:</mo><msqrt><mn>6</mn></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="the square root of 6, end square root, to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>6</mn></msqrt><mo>:</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of 6, end square root, to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>6</mn></msqrt><mo>:</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
